history.content:
Be formal, explain why you have the experience (the grades you got the in the prereqs, any external research in the topic) on par with a grad student.

------

^ You could do that. Or, you could just ask what sorts of background the professor is looking for in undergrads.
Be formal, explain why you have the experience (the grades you got the in the prereqs, any external research in the topic) on par with a grad student.

Hi friends,
I was wondering if there are any rule of thumbs in contacting a professor about potentially enrolling in a graduate course as an undergrad.  Like should I just straight up ask if I can enroll? or do I have to be a little more formal and try to sell myself a bit.
Any feedback would be appreciated


Thanks
history.subject: contacting professor about enrolling in graduate course
